questions.question: Is the central tower of the fortress composed of multiple stacked, progressively smaller rectangular tiers forming a stepped pyramid shape?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the fortress is depicted as a cake with a distinct architectural feature where the central tower is composed of multiple stacked tiers that decrease in size as they ascend, resembling a stepped pyramid shape. This observation suggests the design element intended in the edible representation.

questions.question: Are there regular, alternating tooth-like projections (crenellations) along the upper edges of the fortress walls?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the fortress walls with clear, evenly spaced crenellations, mimicking traditional fortress architecture. These tooth-like projections are designed to enhance the defensive appearance of the fortress structure in this edible model.

questions.question: Is there a prominent arched opening located at the lower front section of the fortress, serving as a main entrance?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the cake-like fortress features an easily distinguishable arched opening at the lower front section. This visually serves as the main entrance to the model, aligning with conventional fortress design.

questions.question: Does the waterfall originate from a gap in the cliff face directly beneath the fortress wall and cascade downward into the river below?
questions.explanation: Image B depicts a waterfall-like feature originating from beneath the fortress, cascading down the side of the cake-like structure. However, it is stylized in an edible format, simulating the appearance of a waterfall flowing seamlessly into a river-like presentation.

questions.question: Is the fortress situated on a raised cliff overlooking a river that flows through a narrow canyon below?
questions.explanation: In Image B, although the edibility limits any realistic geological formation, the fortress appears to be sitting on what mockingly represents a raised cliff, overlooking a river-like formation that mimics flowing through a narrow lower space. This aligns with the typical fortress overlooking natural terrain setting, albeit in a simplified, edible manner.

questions.question: Are clusters of green shrubs and trees visible along the canyon walls and riverbanks surrounding the fortress?
questions.explanation: Image B uses colored edible elements to depict greenery surrounding the fortress. These clusters mimic shrubs and trees, strategically placed along the canyon-like formations and riverbanks in a simplified style, retaining the aesthetic of a natural landscape.

questions.question: Does the fortress have a solid rectangular base with vertical walls and corner towers supporting the upper levels?
questions.explanation: Image B portrays the fortress structure in cake form with a solid rectangular base that extends vertically with walls, and the representation includes corner tower-like extensions, all molded in edible style.
